FuncDef:
The backup-id remote-backup-service command configures a backup ID for an RBP and associates the RBP with a specified RBS.
The undo backup-id remote-backup-service command deletes the backup ID configured for an RBP and removes the association between the RBP and a specified RBS.
By default, no backup ID is configured for an RBP and no RBP is associated with an RBS.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a backup ID for an RBP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4095.

Specifies the name of an RBS.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.
When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable a device to use a backup ID and RBS to find an RBP, run the backup-id remote-backup-service command to configure the backup ID for the RBP and associates the RBP with the RBS.
Prerequisites
An RBS has been created using the remote-backup-service service-name command.
Precautions
The backup IDs configured for the same RBP must be the same on the master and backup devices and can no longer be configured for other RBPs.
